titles.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the second half of the year)

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Sǝnkǝssar ”Synaxarion” for the second half of the year (fols. 3ra-129rb) I-1) Mäggabit (fols. 3ra-23va) I-2) Miyazya (fols. 23vb-40va) I-3) Gǝnbot (fols. 40va-64rc) I-4) Säne (fols. 64ra-78rb) I-5) Ḥamle (fols. 78rc-108ra) I-6) Näḥase (fols. 108rb-126rb) I-7) Ṗagwǝmen (fols. 126rb-129rb)
Additio 1.

copyists.copyist: The name of the scribe has been erased from fol. 129rb.

donors.donor: ʾAmdä Śǝllase is mentioned as the commissioner on fol. 129rb, but his name has been written, in vivid red and in a secondary hand, over an erasure. The original owner of the Ms. might be Wäldä ʾAmlak whose name has been retained on fol. 107rb. The name of the commissioner and his family members have been written over erased names in the supplication formulas: ʾAmdä Śǝllase (e.g., fols. 3rac, 6rabc, 7vc, 21va, 26rb, 30vabc, 94rab), his wife Wälättä Haymanot (fols. 90vc, 92rc, 94rab), Ḫǝdrä Mikaʾel (fols. 19rb, 21rc, 21vb, 95va), Gäbrä Śǝllase (fols. 90va, 92rc), Wäldä Śǝllase (Bä-Gäday) (fols. 90vc, 96rb, 99rbc), ʾƎqwǝba Mikaʾel (fols. 95vb, 104ra). In fols. 3r-90r, the names of Wäldä Mikaʾel (most frequently), Gäbrä Maryam and Sǝḥunä Śǝllase have been added, in black and in another hand, over the names mentioned above.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been rebound (it received new boards and a leather cover). The Ms. is affected by water. Due to water stains, the text is barely legible or illegible in fols. 19rb, 57v, 58r, 84v, 85r. The back board is broken and repaired. The textblock was been trimmed during the rebinding. The right upper corner and the outer edge of fols. 77-84 are damaged. The right lower corner of fols. 19-25 is damaged. Holes are carefully amended in fols. 1, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8, 11, 42, 59, 65, 66, 74, 88, 100, 108, 118, 120.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is broken and repaired) covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Three pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornaments on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 4 tools are used: double line fillet, triple line fillet, double circle, Maltese-cross).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. All quires are reinforced with parchment guards of different sizes (on both the spine folds and centre folds).

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) — I(8/fols. 3r-10v) — II(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 11r-18v) — III(9; s.l.: 6, stub after 2/fols. 19r-27v) — IV(1; s.l.: 1, no stub/fol. 28r-v) — V(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fol. 29r-v) — VI(7; s.l.: 1, no stub/fols. 30r-36v) — VII(8/fols. 37r-44v) — VIII(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 45r-53v) — IX(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 4; 4, stub after 1, 5, stub before 1/fols. 54r-59v) — X(8/fols. 60r-67v) — XI(9; s.l.: 4, stub after 6/fols. 68r-76v) — XII(8/fols. 77r-84v) — XIII(8/fols. 85r-92v) — XIV(8/fols. 93r-100v) — XV(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 101r-107v) — XVI(8/fols. 108r-115v) — XVII(8/fols. 116r-123v) —XVIII(6/fols. 124r-129v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are seldom visible (very close to the edge of the fols.). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The quality of the handwriting changes: in fols. 99rb-100ra tall and slender letters become clearly smaller and broader, in fols. 116rb-118va letters become conspicuously right-sloping.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the commissioner and his family members; group of lines (alternating with black lines) in the incipit pages of the sections; two initial lines of the first commemorative notice of the day and one initial line of the subsequent commemorative notices of the day; the word sälam “salutation” opening the sälam-hymns; elements of text dividers; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

additional.cont: Fol. 129rc: Zä-ˀaqräbku maḫletä... “The song I am offering...”.
additional.det: The note is written in a recent mediocre and hasty hand, in pen.

extras.extra: - Omitted sälam-hymns are written in the upper margin, in the main hand: fols. 47ra, 47vc. - Fragments of supplications and two other passages are visible very close to the upper edge; the letters are cut due to the trimming of the upper edge: fols. 86rb, 100va, 101rab, 116vb, 118vc. - Fragment of Zä-ʾaqräbku maḫletä... “The song I am offering...”, in a recent mediocre hand, in pen: fol. 129rc. - Pen trial: fol. 129rc. - Doodles: fol. 2r.

frames.frame: Fol. 64r (incipit of the text for Säne): simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band; interlace.
